extracted_metadata.Title: Provision of Agriculture Value Chain Mapping Studies in Ghana and Ethiopia

extracted_text:
Expressions of Interest for Provision of Agriculture Value Chain Mapping Studies in Ghana and Ethiopia. The overall objective of the Assignment is to identify promising index insurance opportunities at different stages of the value chains of 3-4 agricultural commodities in Ghana and Ethiopia.
 The Assignment should: (a)Identify and analyze the value chains (b)Assess the nature of farmers and production methods (c)Develop cash flow and financial profiles for value chain players (d)Analyze the demand and supply of finance and index insurance Scope of Work The consultant should collect detailed information on each of the following key supply chain players: 1.Attributes for selecting value chains 2.Farmer Organizations 3.Non farming value chain players (agri SMEs, traders, processors, input suppliers) 4.Microfinance Institutions and Banks 5.Agribusinesses and Input suppliers 6.Estimated market opportunities Methodology (i)Desk and background research and analysis of information prior to in-country field-work; (ii)Meet with CEOs and top line managers of the leading agribusinesses in each commodity group; (iii)Meet agri-SMEs, input suppliers and other agro-traders; (iv)Interview producer organizations and conduct focus groups with individual farmers; (v)Meet with extension service providers, research institutions, government departments and any other key stakeholders.
